content.raw: IIRC the intent is to fix issues when multiple versions of ignition libraries get used in the same executable. Since ignition libraries are side-by-side installable, it’s possible for one of your dependencies to use math 5, while another uses math 6. Even if you don’t use ignition-math yourself, when you link against your dependencies it causes both ignition libraries to get loaded. With unversioned namespaces both libraries would provide the same symbols, violating the one definition rule with unpredictable behavior.
content.html: IIRC the intent is to fix issues when multiple versions of ignition libraries get used in the same executable. Since ignition libraries are side-by-side installable, it’s possible for one of your dependencies to use math 5, while another uses math 6. Even if you don’t use ignition-math yourself, when you link against your dependencies it causes both ignition libraries to get loaded. With unversioned namespaces both libraries would provide the same symbols, violating the one definition rule with unpredictable behavior.
